description: From iso- +‎ -tropic, from Ancient Greek ἴσος (ísos, “equal”) + τροπικός (tropikós, “of or pertaining to a turn or change; or the solstice; or a trope or figure; tropic; tropical; etc.”).

entries.meaning: (physics) Having properties that are identical in all directions; exhibiting isotropy
(mathematics) Having the same components in all rotated coordinate systems
